channel.title: Brush + Sig Attempt
channel.description:
Well, until recently i didn't use Photoshop and so i haven't used brushes but i tried it this time and i got a pretty good result. [img]http://img255.imageshack.us/img255/1561/light2ow3.png[/img]
EDIT: latest version, V2 [img]http://img180.imageshack.us/img180/7640/light3bd1.png[/img] C&C please. Thanks.

item.title: Brush + Sig Attempt
item.dc:creator: @javis javis
item.description:
@javis wrote:

Personally i dont like it. Render could have been blended. Text is bluh. border was bad but u fixed and the effects are well just brushing lol. I dont know how else to say it. Their are dull and boring imo and it makes the tag look flat. Lacks depth.

Read full topic

item.title: Brush + Sig Attempt
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

I preferred the first one. It suits the render much more. It makes the woman look more angelic. If you could make a border that’s white, I think it would be spectacular.

item.title: Brush + Sig Attempt
item.dc:creator: @sonny_bill_9 ``jason
item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

Image:

ThAt0n36Uy:

First of you hit control and select the render layer. Then you go to layers, create new balance layer or something, and it should be one that says color overlay. Play with it till you get a grey/granite color. You could also set your text to white, add a black 1px border and set that layer to overlay. I’ll rate it when I see final.

I tried to do the colour balance, and i think i got it not sure though and i also made the text white.
I didnt really get the 1px black border is that for the whole image or just the text?

GMAN7:

BTW, The Text you used, “Bleeding Cowboys” is amazing but doesn’t suit that signature lawl.

I have changed the font but i am not sure if this one is any nicer, if it isn’t could you suggest one?

Unid H4x0r:

You picked on weird render. Try different fxs.

I like it but i guess it doesnt suit the image… I am not sure if i should change it.

Also there is this thing on the right side, i think i should get rid of it, here it is without the ‘thing’:

Read full topic

item.title: Brush + Sig Attempt
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

First of you hit control and select the render layer. Then you go to layers, create new balance layer or something, and it should be one that says color overlay. Play with it till you get a grey/granite color. You could also set your text to white, add a black 1px border and set that layer to overlay. I’ll rate it when I see final.

Read full topic

item.title: Brush + Sig Attempt
item.dc:creator: @sonny_bill_9 ``jason
item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:6, topic:202219”]V2 is very nice. Even for just brushing and a render the tone is very nice. you might should think about a color overlay over the render. Toning it down some. You could also try and use a 2 px black border, and then set it to overlay. That would add to the feel.

Nice work ``jason.[/quote]
Cool, thanks for that it really gives me a good idea of what to do.
I like the idea of the 2px black border after adding that it gives it a real finished look:


Though i don’t really understand the colour overlay part, if you could explain it i will try my best to do that.
Thanks and can you rate it out of 10?

Edit: and i must say, when you reply with comments like that it changes how i think of you.

Read full topic

item.title: Brush + Sig Attempt
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

V2 is very nice. Even for just brushing and a render the tone is very nice. you might should think about a color overlay over the render. Toning it down some. You could also try and use a 2 px black border, and then set it to overlay. That would add to the feel.

Nice work ``jason.

item.title: Brush + Sig Attempt
item.dc:creator: @sonny_bill_9 ``jason
item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

ninja nub:

It’s pretty nice, but the image sticks out to much. It looks like it doesn’t belong. But at the same time, it would look bad below the border. Try giving the image a bit more depth then add the image under the border.

Ok, i will do that and edit my original post.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 24, 2008, 09:39:12 PM[/size][hr]I have slightly changed it but i am not sure if i should keep the render there or get rid of it…

Read full topic
